devdoc.author: Calvin Chen

params._proof: A string with a proof code to verify the authenticity of the number generation
params._queryId: The query id that was generated to proofVerify
params._result: String that contains the number generated

params.numberToBet: The number that the player wants to bet for. Must be between 1 and 10 both inclusive

params.player: The address of the player to check

checkPlayerExists(address).return: bool Returns true is it exists or false if it doesn't

params._maxAmountOfBets: The max amount of bets that are required for each game
params._minimumBet: The minimum bet that each user has to make in order to participate in the game

devdoc.title: Contract to bet Ether for a number and win randomly when the number of bets is met. Credit to Merunas Grincalaitis for the framework for this Smart Contract

__callback(bytes32,string,bytes).notice: Callback function that gets called by oraclize when the random number is generated

bet(uint256).notice: To bet for a number by sending Ether

checkPlayerExists(address).notice: Check if a player exists in the current game

methods.constructor: Constructor that's used to configure the minimum bet per game and the max amount of bets

distributePrizes().notice: Sends the corresponding Ether to each winner then deletes all the players for the next game and resets the `totalBet` and `numberOfBets`

generateNumberWinner().notice: Generates a random number between 1 and 10 both inclusive. Must be payable because oraclize needs gas to generate a random number. Can only be executed when the game ends.
